In this role, you will play a critical part in shaping Docker‚Äôs data strategy by leading the design, development, and optimization of data models, reports, and dashboards that support strategic business goals. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization and mentor junior analysts to foster a culture of continuous learning.

This role is perfect for someone with advanced data analysis expertise, a passion for solving complex problems, and a track record of delivering impactful insights. The level of responsibility and scope will be tailored based on your experience and strengths, making it an ideal opportunity for professionals looking to advance their careers in data.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Strategy & Execution: Lead data initiatives by designing, developing, and optimizing data models and reporting structures that support the organization‚Äôs strategic objectives.
  • Data Analysis & Transformation: Conduct advanced data analysis, leveraging tools like Snowflake, DBT, and SQL to ensure accuracy, consistency, and actionable insights across various data sources.
  • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain scalable, robust data models that enable both real-time and ad-hoc analysis, driving key business decisions.
  • Reporting & Dashboards: Create, manage, and optimize dashboards and reports using Looker, providing stakeholders with clear, actionable insights.
  • Collaboration: Partner closely with business teams, data engineers, and leadership to understand and meet data needs, aligning data initiatives with broader business goals.
  • Mentorship & Team Development: Provide mentorship to other analysts, fostering professional growth and encouraging best practices across the team.
  • Data Governance & Quality: Drive data quality initiatives, identifying and resolving inconsistencies while defining best practices for data governance.
  • Continuous Improvement: Continuously refine and enhance data models, reporting pipelines, and processes to support evolving business needs and ensure scalability.

Key Skills and Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to deliver impactful data solutions in fast-paced environments.
  • Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in SQL and strong experience with data warehousing and ETL/ELT processes. Familiarity with Snowflake, DBT, and Looker is highly desirable.
  • Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and generate actionable insights to inform business decisions.
  • Communication: Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Leadership & Mentorship: Experience mentoring junior team members and contributing to team development. Ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams in data-driven initiatives.
  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or Mathematics.
  • Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to data, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables, while maintaining a high standard of data quality.

What to expect in the first 30 days:

  • Understand Docker‚Äôs Data Landscape: Deep dive into Docker‚Äôs data systems, processes, and business objectives to build a strong foundation for future contributions.
  • Collaborate with Teams: Engage with cross-functional teams to gain insight into ongoing data initiatives and identify how you can contribute.
  • Start Contributing: Begin taking ownership of smaller data analysis tasks, providing insights, and shaping solutions that align with business needs.

What to expect in the first 90 days:

  • Lead Key Projects: Take full ownership of critical data analysis projects, ensuring they are aligned with strategic business goals and delivered on time.
  • Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver insights that directly impact business outcomes.
  • Partner with Data Engineers: Collaborate with data engineers to ensure the scalability, reliability, and optimization of data pipelines and models.
  • Execute and Deliver: Focus on delivering data solutions that meet timelines, driving execution, and continuously identifying areas for improvement in processes and systems.
  • Mentor and Support: Provide mentorship to other data analysts, offering guidance and support in executing data projects while fostering a collaborative team environment

What to expect in the first year:

  • Drive Large-Scale Initiatives: Lead and deliver large-scale data initiatives that meet business objectives and drive meaningful outcomes.
  • Optimize and Evolve: Continuously optimize data models, dashboards, and reporting structures to support evolving business needs.
  • Become a Key Contributor: Establish yourself as a strategic leader within Docker‚Äôs data team, driving data-driven decision-making and scaling processes to ensure long-term success.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Role to start on Monday 27th January!

We are hiring a Data Quality and analytics Intern for our innovative and dynamic Localization Data and AI team. Our mission is to ensure high-quality data solutions across multiple projects, including dashboards, player telemetry, and algorithm/model validations. The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for data, quality assurance, and technology and a keen eye for detail.

As an intern at EA, you will work closely with our team to ensure the coherence, functionality, and quality of the data solutions we deliver. To identify and resolve defects you will review dashboards, data models, and algorithms, ensuring they meet our high standards of accuracy and consistency. You will gain experience in QA processes, collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers, and contribute to improving the localization efforts across EA.

Responsibilities


Review and ensure the quality of dashboards (e.g., PowerBI) and data visualizations for internal stakeholders
Assist in analyzing application performance and functionality of algorithms and machine learning models developed by the team
Perform functional and unit tests for each deployment as well as final checks on data integrity across our systems, ensuring consistency and coherence
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to identify and troubleshoot potential issues in data solutions
Support the development of automated QA processes for data pipelines and models
Provide insights and recommendations to enhance the reliability of our data solutions
Document test results and create detailed bug reports to communicate QA findings and present results to team members and stakeholders


Qualifications


Pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, or a related STEM field
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Experience with Power BI, Excel and SQL
Familiarity with machine learning models and their validation processes
Basic understanding of agile methodology, software testing principles and methodologies
Knowledge of Python
A strong interest in Quality Assurance for data projects
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across teams
A passion for gaming and data-driven solutions is a plus
Experience with Jira and Confluence is a plus
Proficiency in English

Title: Data Analyst - Internship
Description:
Please note: This is a 6-month internship position, not a full-time junior role. However, outstanding performance throughout the internship may lead to a transition into a full-time junior position after the internship.




About Us




Crata AI is an innovative startup helping businesses strategically adopt AI to accelerate growth and gain a competitive edge.




We design, develop, and integrate custom AI solutions, serving as the strategic partner for forward-thinking companies to leverage the AI revolution for transformational innovation and sustained success.




We are expanding quickly and seeking individuals who are not just looking for a position but an opportunity to make a difference. If you're passionate about AI, technology, and driving innovation, we want to hear from you.




What Will You Do




Business Intelligence & Data Analysis: Analyze complex datasets to extract actionable insights and support strategic decision-making across various business functions. Translate findings into clear recommendations for stakeholders.




Data Visualization & Reporting: Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI to visualize key performance indicators and business metrics. Ensure data accuracy by integrating multiple data sources and refining visualization techniques.




Data Automation: Develop and implement automated processes to streamline data collection, reporting, and other business operations. Use tools and scripts to reduce manual effort and enhance efficiency.




Who Are We Looking For




Must-Have:

Business Intelligence and Data Analysis Skills: Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis and making data-driven recommendations.
Power BI Proficiency: Experience in creating and managing interactive dashboards and reports.
SQL Skills: Proficiency in SQL for querying databases and handling large datasets.
Data Automation Experience: Experience with automation tools or scripts for data processes.
Problem-Solving Mindset: Ability to approach problems creatively and analytically.
Communication Skills: Fluent in both Spanish and English (minimum C1 level), with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High accuracy in data handling and report development.
Adaptability: Comfortable working in a dynamic startup environment with rapidly changing priorities.
Project Management Skills: Ability to manage multiple tasks or small projects simultaneously.




Nice-to-Have:

Python Knowledge: Basic experience with Python for data manipulation and automation.
Experience with Other BI Tools: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, QlikView, Looker, or libraries such as D3.js and Matplotlib.
Machine Learning Familiarity: Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and their business applications.
Data Warehousing Knowledge: Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Previous Experience: Experience in data analysis, BI, or related roles, especially in a startup or fast-paced environment.




What Do We Offer

Remunerated Internship: Competitive compensation for your contributions.
Fully Remote Position and Flexible Schedule: Work from anywhere with a schedule that fits your lifestyle.
Hands-On Experience: Direct impact on growth in a dynamic startup environment.
Learning and Growth: Opportunities to develop diverse skills and advance in a fast-paced environment.
Career Advancement: Potential for a full-time role upon successful completion of the internship and proven performance.




How to Apply

Please send your CV to¬†alejandro@crata-ai.com, along with any materials showcasing your data analysis or visualization skills. Include a brief statement (no more than 10 lines) explaining why you are interested in this role, why you would be a great fit, and why we should consider you for an initial interview.

Title: Analytics Senior Analyst
Description:
Position Overview

Details of the role and how it fits into the team

As Analytics Senior Analyst you will be a member of our Data Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE) for Group Audit. You will pioneer and support Group Audit in implementing innovative and effective analytics processes that are critical to the success of our audit function. Based in the Madrid office, you will work embedded in audit teams around the world, applying the latest analytics technologies while connecting with the central team in Germany to leverage our core analytics solutions. You will be responsible for supporting all Group Audit functions with data analytics services and audit automation solutions.

Responsibilities


Evaluate and provide analytics solutions to auditors to identify potential risk, anomalies, detect outliers and identify weaknesses in control activities using analytical tools like SQL and Python.
Collaborate closely with auditors, data owner and subject matter experts to understand business requirement and translate them into analytical solution in an agile and iterative manner.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders including Senior Management that support informed decision-making process and effectively drive business strategy.
Proactively identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient.
Drive innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects.



Skills


Master‚Äôs or bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent ‚Äì PhD appreciated) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis as well as in reporting and visualization with hands-on experience in ETL and datawarehouse, Hadoop, Hive/Impala as well as familiarity with GCP services and tools, OpenShift, CDSW,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in clear and concise manner to Senior Management, Audit committees and other stakeholder.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skill to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.
A creative technologist passionate about data and information with an intrinsic motivation and curious to learn new technologies and frameworks to adopt data analytics for new ways of auditing.



Well-being & Benefits

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That‚Äôs why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.


Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health.
Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, discount in gyms, annual medical check up's, standing desks, ...
Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, hybrid model of remote working (for some positions ‚Ä¶)
Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from meal allowance, pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, flex compensation program...



We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

HTML:
Position Overview

Details of the role and how it fits into the team

As Analytics Senior Analyst you will be a member of our Data Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE) for Group Audit. You will pioneer and support Group Audit in implementing innovative and effective analytics processes that are critical to the success of our audit function. Based in the Madrid office, you will work embedded in audit teams around the world, applying the latest analytics technologies while connecting with the central team in Germany to leverage our core analytics solutions. You will be responsible for supporting all Group Audit functions with data analytics services and audit automation solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Evaluate and provide analytics solutions to auditors to identify potential risk, anomalies, detect outliers and identify weaknesses in control activities using analytical tools like SQL and Python.
  • Collaborate closely with auditors, data owner and subject matter experts to understand business requirement and translate them into analytical solution in an agile and iterative manner.
  • Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders including Senior Management that support informed decision-making process and effectively drive business strategy.
  • Proactively identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient.
  • Drive innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects.


Skills

  • Master‚Äôs or bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent ‚Äì PhD appreciated) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis as well as in reporting and visualization with hands-on experience in ETL and datawarehouse, Hadoop, Hive/Impala as well as familiarity with GCP services and tools, OpenShift, CDSW,
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in clear and concise manner to Senior Management, Audit committees and other stakeholder.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skill to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.
  • A creative technologist passionate about data and information with an intrinsic motivation and curious to learn new technologies and frameworks to adopt data analytics for new ways of auditing.


Well-being & Benefits

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That‚Äôs why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.

  • Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health.
  • Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, discount in gyms, annual medical check up's, standing desks, ...
  • Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, hybrid model of remote working (for some positions ‚Ä¶)
  • Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from meal allowance, pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, flex compensation program...


We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!


A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.


How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.




Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks



Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: CRO Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we: At Pearson, our mission is to add life to a lifetime of learning. We believe in the transformative power of education and are dedicated to creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. Our vision is to help everyone realize the life they imagine through learning. We are committed to bravery, decency, and imagination in everything we do. Recently, Pearson has been recognized for its innovative approach to education and its commitment to sustainability, earning accolades for our efforts in driving positive change in the learning landscape. We are a leading provider of English language proficiency tests, committed to delivering high-quality, reliable, and accessible testing solutions. We are dedicated to ensuring that our PTE (Pearson Test of English) test takers have the best possible experience from registration through to receiving their results. Learn more at: Our Company | Pearson plc




We have a fantastic opportunity for a CRO Data Analyst to join Pearson's world-leading English Language Learning (ELL) division to help build deeper, data-driven insights into our flagship global English language test portfolio, including the Pearson Test of English (PTE).




Working as part of the ELL Marketing‚Äôs eCommerce team, the right individual will have strong foundational skills in Google Marketing Cloud reporting applications. You will work closely with teams across Marketing, Technology and Product to extract, analyse and visualise data about our current digital experience, and to create insights and observations that help steer everything from our marketing and CRO strategies to our UX and digital product roadmaps. Ultimately, your contributions will help us to grow our revenues, market share, and build better experiences for millions of customers.




Key responsibilities

Research and analyse multiple data sources to identify emerging trends and issues that inform our optimization and development roadmaps ‚Äì including:
web analytics (GA4, heatmap & session replay)
eCommerce
internal and external search keywords and queries
marketing CRM
Net Promoter Score (NPS)
Develop comprehensive traffic forecasts to support broader eCommerce trading goals. Monitor performance with weekly CRM trading reports to assess their contribution to revenue vs target.
Prepare and present findings to stakeholders, translating complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.
Input into the development of A/B testing strategies and analyze results to inform future marketing campaigns.
Monitor and analyze competitor performance and industry trends to identify best practices.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular audits and validation processes.




Qualifications, skills & experience

Relevant qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with a focus on digital marketing and D2C audiences.
Proficiency in Google Marketing Cloud tools (e.g., GA4, Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console, BigQuery).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Google Looker Studio).
Familiarity with standard compliance practices (GDPR, etc)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with SQL or other data querying languages is a plus.
Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to equity and opportunity, so that all learners can realise the life they imagine and see themselves in our services and products. We believe learning is a powerful force for change and that diversity, equity and inclusion are fundamental to who we are. We‚Äôre committed to addressing all forms of systematic racism, discrimination and inequality in everything we do. We also believe in giving everyone in the company the chance to help shape a more inclusive culture, in which everyone feels a sense of belonging and in which everyone acts with integrity day-in, day-out. To learn more about Pearson‚Äôs commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here.

Pearson is an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants and select the best person for each job based on relevant skills and experience. We are also committed to building an accurate picture of the make-up of the workforce and encouraging equality and diversity. The information you provide will stay confidential and will be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process. We are a Stonewall Gold and Top 20 LGBT+ inclusive employer, Investors in People Gold, Race Charter signatory, Disability Confident employer and Working Mums Top Employer.

HTML:
Who are we: At Pearson, our mission is to add life to a lifetime of learning. We believe in the transformative power of education and are dedicated to creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. Our vision is to help everyone realize the life they imagine through learning. We are committed to bravery, decency, and imagination in everything we do. Recently, Pearson has been recognized for its innovative approach to education and its commitment to sustainability, earning accolades for our efforts in driving positive change in the learning landscape. We are a leading provider of English language proficiency tests, committed to delivering high-quality, reliable, and accessible testing solutions. We are dedicated to ensuring that our PTE (Pearson Test of English) test takers have the best possible experience from registration through to receiving their results. Learn more at: Our Company | Pearson plc


We have a fantastic opportunity for a CRO Data Analyst to join Pearson's world-leading English Language Learning (ELL) division to help build deeper, data-driven insights into our flagship global English language test portfolio, including the Pearson Test of English (PTE).


Working as part of the ELL Marketing‚Äôs eCommerce team, the right individual will have strong foundational skills in Google Marketing Cloud reporting applications. You will work closely with teams across Marketing, Technology and Product to extract, analyse and visualise data about our current digital experience, and to create insights and observations that help steer everything from our marketing and CRO strategies to our UX and digital product roadmaps. Ultimately, your contributions will help us to grow our revenues, market share, and build better experiences for millions of customers.


Key responsibilities

  • Research and analyse multiple data sources to identify emerging trends and issues that inform our optimization and development roadmaps ‚Äì including:
  • web analytics (GA4, heatmap & session replay)
  • eCommerce
  • internal and external search keywords and queries
  • marketing CRM
  • Net Promoter Score (NPS)
  • Develop comprehensive traffic forecasts to support broader eCommerce trading goals. Monitor performance with weekly CRM trading reports to assess their contribution to revenue vs target.
  • Prepare and present findings to stakeholders, translating complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.
  • Input into the development of A/B testing strategies and analyze results to inform future marketing campaigns.
  • Monitor and analyze competitor performance and industry trends to identify best practices.
  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular audits and validation processes.


Qualifications, skills & experience

  • Relevant qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with a focus on digital marketing and D2C audiences.
  • Proficiency in Google Marketing Cloud tools (e.g., GA4, Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console, BigQuery).
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Google Looker Studio).
  • Familiarity with standard compliance practices (GDPR, etc)
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with SQL or other data querying languages is a plus.
  • Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to equity and opportunity, so that all learners can realise the life they imagine and see themselves in our services and products. We believe learning is a powerful force for change and that diversity, equity and inclusion are fundamental to who we are. We‚Äôre committed to addressing all forms of systematic racism, discrimination and inequality in everything we do. We also believe in giving everyone in the company the chance to help shape a more inclusive culture, in which everyone feels a sense of belonging and in which everyone acts with integrity day-in, day-out. To learn more about Pearson‚Äôs commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here.

Pearson is an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants and select the best person for each job based on relevant skills and experience. We are also committed to building an accurate picture of the make-up of the workforce and encouraging equality and diversity. The information you provide will stay confidential and will be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process. We are a Stonewall Gold and Top 20 LGBT+ inclusive employer, Investors in People Gold, Race Charter signatory, Disability Confident employer and Working Mums Top Employer.

Title: Data Analyst, Crypto and Payments
Description:
About MoonPay üåñüí∏




Hi, we‚Äôre MoonPay. We‚Äôre here to onboard the world to Web3.




Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.




What we do

We‚Äôre the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products ‚Äî just take a look on Trustpilot.




We‚Äôre also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.




But that‚Äôs not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It‚Äôs taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.




So whatever your background, we‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.




About the Opportunity ‚úçÔ∏è

This is an opportunity for an ambitious Data Analyst to have a huge impact across the organization, while working in a complex and rapidly changing crypto environment. We are looking for someone with experience or an interest in end-to-end ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, including: data strategy, analytics engineering, (advanced) analytics and data science. The main focus of this position will be to play a crucial role in supporting our Accounting and FP&A functions.







What you will do

Build robust data models and infrastructure downstream of backend services and external data sources, which support reconciliation, internal reporting, and ad-hoc analysis
Develop ‚ÄúThe Ledger‚Äù, which tracks all our crypto and fiat movements from external data sources
Design, build and scale a MoonPay-wide approach to reconciliation for cash and crypto using both internal and external data sources.
Conduct more strategic analysis on specific topics such as the Flow of Funds from both a cash and crypto perspective
Collaborate with the finance team and the crypto engineering team to conduct investigations into areas such as issues with crypto delivery
Working closely with accounting & finance to build custom tables & reporting to support their efforts.
Communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences (across different teams)
Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams on Product, Engineering, and Finance




About You

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be expected to work cross-functionally with different parts of the organization while maintaining a focus on Data and Finance. Being someone who can build robust data models to contribute to the current ecosystem of data products. We are seeking someone with experience or an interest in ‚Äúfull-stack‚Äù data work, from data engineering to data analytics.




What you will need

Advanced SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools are second nature to you
You have experience of and/or interest in working with a finance team, or within a finance function
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including finance managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives







Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our ‚ÄúBLOCK Values‚Äù are at the heart of everything we do - and they are‚Ä¶




B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen




MoonPay Perks

Equity package üìà

Unlimited holidays üèù

Paid parental leave üçº

Annual training budget üíª

Home office setup allowance ü™ë

Monthly budget to spend on our products üí∞

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless üöÄ

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility üí™




Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.




Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we‚Äôll do our best to provide assistance.




Commitment To Diversity

At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That‚Äôs why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.




Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About The Job

Every time we eat and drink, we choose the world we want to live in. We believe that the health of people and the planet are 100% interconnected. This is what our One Planet One Health vision conveys. We invite you to join our food revolution with the goal of creating a healthier world.

Are you passionate about IT&DATA? Join our BTheOne Program and start your journey at Danone!

Your main objectives will be the following


Work on real-world projects that provide practical experience and deepen your expertise in data analytics tools such as SQL, excel, powerbi, and python.
Gather and structure data from various sources, collect, prepare, and understand data, and present clear information.
Contribute to the improvement of data quality and support the delivery of data products.
Develop solutions to specific challenges that are compliant with our data quality framework and collaborate with internal data teams.
Utilize powerpoint skills to report results to relevant stakeholders and communicate effectively with them.
Collaborate with professionals around the world and gain insights and guidance from experienced data leads.


About you

Do not hesitate to apply if...


In your studies, you‚Äôve focused on Business Analytics, Data Analytics , IT, or Software Engineering
You‚Äôre familiar with Office 365 programs, and have a strong interest in product development
You have experience with SQL, and it‚Äôs a plus if you have skills with one or more of the following technologies SAP, Python, Snowflake, Informatica, MS PowerBI
You have strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual capabilities
You have a high level of English
And above all... you are looking forward to learning in a multinational company like Danone üôÇ


About us

Working at Danone gives you the opportunity to impact more than 12 million consumers in Spain, where we lead the ranking of the most chosen brands in the country.

At Danone you will work to make a vision a reality ‚ÄúOne Planet, One Health‚Äù and it doesn't matter where you are to make an impact on it.

Here, you will have space to create, to undertake, to grow and above all to be yourself, thanks to our culture of Inclusive Diversity, where we are clear that ‚Äúour differences are what make the difference‚Äù.

You will work with agile methodologies, in high performance teams where you will learn, influence and contribute to achieve specific goals and grow with the company.

We want you to come and see for yourself, but if you want more information first, click here to convince you danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

At Danone we are 100% committed to guaranteeing selection processes free of bias and equal opportunities. For this we have trained all the people who participate in them. Because to work with us, what matters to us is what you can contribute and nothing else.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties And Responsibilities


Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.

HTML:
The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

  • Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
    • Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
    • Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.
    • Perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Interacting with internal clients
    • Dealing with data providers in client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received, and follow up with data providers on data issues.
    • Dealing directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
    • Presenting results to clients in a clear and respectful manner, and maintaining professionalism in collecting feedback
    • Project management and quality assurance of active projects
  • Dashboard and Visualization Development
    • Develop visually appealing and intuitive dashboards
    • Leverage advanced visualization techniques to effectively communicate insights
    • Ensure adherence to best practices in data visualization, story building and user experience design
Required

  • Student of Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or similar studies.
  • Advanced level of English, both written and verbal, strong communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Knowledge of SQL, R Statistical software and/or Python
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence principles and concepts
  • Interest in gaming is a big plus.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About The Job

Every time we eat and drink, we choose the world we want to live in. We believe that the health of people and the planet are 100% interconnected. This is what our One Planet One Health vision conveys. We invite you to join our food revolution with the goal of creating a healthier world.

Are you passionate about IT&DATA? Join our BTheOne Program and start your journey at Danone!

Your main objectives will be the following


Work on real-world projects that provide practical experience and deepen your expertise in data analytics tools such as SQL, excel, powerbi, and python.
Gather and structure data from various sources, collect, prepare, and understand data, and present clear information.
Contribute to the improvement of data quality and support the delivery of data products.
Develop solutions to specific challenges that are compliant with our data quality framework and collaborate with internal data teams.
Utilize powerpoint skills to report results to relevant stakeholders and communicate effectively with them.
Collaborate with professionals around the world and gain insights and guidance from experienced data leads.


About you

Do not hesitate to apply if...


In your studies, you‚Äôve focused on Business Analytics, Data Analytics , IT, or Software Engineering
You‚Äôre familiar with Office 365 programs, and have a strong interest in product development
You have experience with SQL, and it‚Äôs a plus if you have skills with one or more of the following technologies SAP, Python, Snowflake, Informatica, MS PowerBI
You have strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual capabilities
You have a high level of English
And above all... you are looking forward to learning in a multinational company like Danone üôÇ


About us

Working at Danone gives you the opportunity to impact more than 12 million consumers in Spain, where we lead the ranking of the most chosen brands in the country.

At Danone you will work to make a vision a reality ‚ÄúOne Planet, One Health‚Äù and it doesn't matter where you are to make an impact on it.

Here, you will have space to create, to undertake, to grow and above all to be yourself, thanks to our culture of Inclusive Diversity, where we are clear that ‚Äúour differences are what make the difference‚Äù.

You will work with agile methodologies, in high performance teams where you will learn, influence and contribute to achieve specific goals and grow with the company.

We want you to come and see for yourself, but if you want more information first, click here to convince you danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

At Danone we are 100% committed to guaranteeing selection processes free of bias and equal opportunities. For this we have trained all the people who participate in them. Because to work with us, what matters to us is what you can contribute and nothing else.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desde Prosegur buscamos un/a Analista de Datos. La posici√≥n se ubica en Madrid y contar√°s con modelo h√≠brido de trabajo (compaginando teletrabajo con asistencia a la oficina).

¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n?

La misi√≥n de esta posici√≥n es generar reportes de alto nivel para departamentos internos como Finanzas, Tecnolog√≠a y Transformaci√≥n, proporcionando informaci√≥n clave que facilite la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas. Nos enfocamos en crear reportes que sean √∫tiles para el comit√© de direcci√≥n en todos los departamentos y pa√≠ses, asegurando una respuesta y soluci√≥n efectiva a sus necesidades

¬øQu√© funciones vas a realizar?

Nuestro proyecto abarca desde colaborar con el personal operativo de cada departamento para evaluar la calidad de los datos y determinar su origen, hasta trabajar directamente con los directores para generar reportes siguiendo sus directrices.

Las tareas incluyen:


Conocimiento del dato: Comprender profundamente los datos disponibles.
An√°lisis de la calidad del dato: Evaluar la precisi√≥n y fiabilidad de los datos.
Mejora de la calidad del dato y estandarizaci√≥n de procesos: Implementar mejoras y estandarizar procesos cuando sea necesario.
Generaci√≥n del reporte final: Crear reportes finales con la colaboraci√≥n de los directores de cada departamento.
Formaci√≥n a los usuarios finales: Capacitar a los usuarios finales en el uso y comprensi√≥n de los reportes generados.


¬øQu√© buscamos de ti?

Principalmente queremos incorporar a personas comprometidas, con inter√©s/pasi√≥n real por el an√°lisis de datos y con muchas ganas de aprender en un entorno retador como Prosegur. Adem√°s:


Estudios superiores en Ingenier√≠a, Matem√°ticas, estad√≠stica, econom√≠a y/o afines
Experiencia previa de al menos 2 a√±os en posiciones similares
Nivel avanzado de PBI: Conocimiento de modelado de datos en PowerQuery, generar un modelo tipo estrellas en PBI, Conocimiento/Experto del universo DAX.
Valorable conocimiento en lenguaje de programaci√≥n
Valorable ingl√©s nivel B2


¬øQu√© te ofrecemos?


Formar parte de un equipo internacional (con presencia en 34 pa√≠ses).
Trabajar en un entorno din√°mico con un excelente ambiente laboral.
Participar en proyectos estrat√©gicos y disruptivos.
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado.
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur.
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales a trav√©s de Reflex.
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar.
Colaborar con nuestra Fundaci√≥n para crear una sociedad m√°s justa.


Nuestro Prop√≥sito y nuestros Valores

‚ÄúCuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar m√°s seguro, manteni√©ndonos a la vanguardia de la innovaci√≥n‚Äù es lo que nos motiva desde hace m√°s de 40 a√±os.

Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnolog√≠as m√°s punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchain, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a trav√©s de nuestras cinco l√≠neas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.

Nuestros m√°s de 175.000 profesionales presentes en 34 pa√≠ses nos han convertido en un referente en el sector de la seguridad y nos ayudan cada d√≠a a mantener y compartir nuestros valores: Nos importan las personas, pensamos en positivo y somos imparables.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Vilanova i la Geltr√∫, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Everything you are looking for and more üì¶

This position focuses on analyzing and improving logistics network efficiency, particularly optimizing the first, middle, and last-mile processes. As a key contributor to operational insights and decision-making, you will leverage advanced analytics, build predictive models, and create dashboards to monitor and enhance network performance. Collaboration with cross-market teams is central to this role, as is the ability to design and implement KPIs aligned with business objectives.

What responsibilities and objectives will you have?




¬∑ Conduct an exploratory analysis of the effectiveness of the network, with a particular focus on first, middle and last mile optimization to improve overall network efficiency

¬∑ Develop and present insights and recommendations based on the analysis conducted

¬∑ Work with all our markets to develop advanced operational analytics with a focus on improving the efficiency of the network

¬∑ Build models to support management decision making

¬∑ Develop compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new initiatives

¬∑ Conduct weekly KPI reporting to help broader teams make insightful data-driven decisions

¬∑ Design and develop new KPIs in line with business objectives to track performance

¬∑ Create and maintain documentation of analysis, KPIs and business definitions







Well, what will the requirements be?




¬∑ Fluency in English for verbal and written communication

¬∑ Proven experience as a data analyst or similar role

¬∑ Ability to work with large data sets, optimize queries/calculations and visualize data

¬∑ Ability to identify relationships between different pieces of information, draw logical and reliable conclusions and communicate them in a business-friendly manner

¬∑ Ability to apply statistical and mathematical knowledge to analysis

¬∑ Strong knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)

¬∑ Strong knowledge of SQL to build database queries

¬∑ Experience of working with data from a variety of sources (e.g. DWH, DataLake, Databricks, SQL and noSQL databases)

¬∑ Proficient in Excel

¬∑ Experience with Power BI and Power Automate

¬∑ Strong analytical skills

¬∑ Excellent organizational skills, proactive attitude and ability to work effectively under time pressure

¬∑ Experience on the logistics sector would be a plus (related to data analysis)







What do we offer?

Excellent working enviroment

Professional growth within the company

Flexible working hours

Online platform for lifelong learning

Competitive salary

Flexible remuneration services can be contracted




Inclusive Culture

InPost has an Equal Opportunities Plan that promotes equality at all levels. We aim for equality in the company's workplaces, as it is focused on promotion, within and outside the company, as well as gender equality, diversity, equity and inclusion of people regardless of their abilities and conditions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (6-Month Contract, Remote, Spain)




Position: Data Analyst Duration: 6 months contract Location: Remote working from Spain Languages: Spanish and English




Are you an experienced Data Analyst interested in new contracting assignments in Spain? Our client has a new long term project and is currently looking to build a team of data consultants. The contract will be on a B2B freelancing basis for an initial duration of 6 months with opportunities to extend further.




Key Responsibilities:

Connect and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and key insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the data, detect anomalies, and uncover hidden patterns.
Design and create dynamic reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate insights.
Collaborate with data engineering teams and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Design and maintain dashboards and reporting datasets.




Required Skills:

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, or similar data visualization tools.
Strong knowledge of SQL, Power Query, and DAX for querying and extracting data from databases.
Experience with statistical tools or languages such as R, Python, or SAS; MDX is a plus.
Familiarity with data manipulation and transformation processes, including ETL (Extract, Transform, Load).

Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to work with large, complex datasets.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with various departments and stakeholders.
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (PL-300) or similar certificates.
Tableau Certified: Tableau Certified Data Analyst.
Tableau Certified: Tableau Desktop Specialist is a plus.




For more details on this opportunity, please feel free to email me on jasmin.higham@recann.co.uk or submit an application and we will be in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fueling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.

Your background

3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:




The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.

We are specifically looking for a Business Analyst III to single-handedly support our Customer Retention Marketing and Blog programs, which have touch points with 5-6 million unique users monthly. This analyst will act as a trusted thought partner to marketing stakeholders with a focus on overhauling data infrastructure, driving measurable outcomes, optimizing our brand content strategy, and scaling cross-sell programs across our many customer engagement channels. They will have experience operating autonomously to deliver on complex, cross-functional initiatives.




Your Responsibilities:

Build the lifecycle data infrastructure from the ground up ‚Äì defining our measurement strategy (A/B tests, rotating holdouts, etc.), building conversion-based datasets for near-real-time customer interactions, and facilitating an expansion into push notifications and paid reactivation campaigns
Partner with our global brand team to optimize our brand content across multiple channels, including email, blog, and organic channels.
Own the cross-sell analytical functions for our email and blog programs, growing the reach of our brand voice to new target audiences.
Influence the global strategy of your partner teams by crafting and refining key performance indicators that measure the health of our business




Your Qualifications:

At least 4 years experience working cross-functionally with complex datasets to support organizational decision making.
Fluency in SQL. You would feel confident reviewing code produced by other analysts and data scientists, as well as assisting non-technical colleagues with their reports in an office hours setting.
Hands-on experience running A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
Familiarity with programming in Python or R.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate models and results to business partners in a useful, concise, and meaningful way.
Experience working with cross-functional business partners to define business problems, scope project deliverables/timelines, implement reporting solutions, and frame organizational strategy.
You prioritize your work on impact to the business and can gracefully push back on stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Two-sided marketplace and/or marketing analytics experience
Understanding of digital touchpoints and measurement mechanisms
Marketing analytics with a focus on customer lifecycle marketing
Meaningful experience processing large data sets at scale. This could include languages like Python or R, as well as frameworks like Spark, Hive, or dbt.
Experience with AWS (Redshift, S3, EMR)
Understanding of modeling techniques, such as linear regressions, causal impact models, and bootstrapping. You know the trade-offs of each of these models and can propose the right model for the test at hand




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you‚Äôll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we‚Äôre pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Administrativo de Datos Junior
Description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We‚Äôre looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Objetivos

Este puesto es un rol clave en el mantenimiento de los sistemas que soportan las operaciones de la f√°brica.

El Analista de Datos Locales (LDA) crea, cambia y mantiene los datos maestros locales (GMPs y de negocio) de la planta utilizando los procesos y procedimientos establecidos. Como parte de ese mantenimiento de los datos est√°n las tareas de recopilaci√≥n, introducci√≥n y limpieza de los datos en los sistemas SAP (R3/APO) y PMX entre otros, seg√∫n los Procedimientos operativos est√°ndar (SOP) aprobados.

Es el responsable de mantener en los sistemas el Material Master, Estructuras (BOM¬¥s), Recetas, Recursos (Centros de Trabajo), Matrices de Transici√≥n y los Procedimientos de Producci√≥n de empaquetado, asegurando que los datos locales sean precisos y correctos mediante procesos de verificaci√≥n y auditorias peri√≥dicas.

Responsabilidades


Mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro, trabajar de manera segura y responsable y apoyar todos los Objetivos Corporativos de Salud, Seguridad y Medio Ambiente.
Ejecutar la actualizaci√≥n de todos los datos maestros en los sistemas MES y WES de la planta de producci√≥n. Todo ello en coordinaci√≥n con los Global y Local Data Analyst de otras afiliadas y los responsables de datos maestros de las diferentes √°reas de la F√°brica.
Gestionar las peticiones de cambios de datos a trav√©s de las herramientas aprobadas.
Participar activamente en la discontinuaciones de productos desarrollando las tareas correspondientes al Local data Analyst en los tiempos marcados.
Cumplir la ejecuci√≥n de las Pol√≠ticas Globales y Procedimientos locales.
Verificar peri√≥dicamente los datos en los sistemas y garantizar su exactitud y consistencia.
Proporcionar a las √°reas que lo requieran todo el soporte necesario en temas de datos para la optimizaci√≥n de sus procesos y para la resoluci√≥n de incidencias del d√≠a a d√≠a.
Participar en revisiones y actualizaciones anuales de costes y est√°ndares en preparaci√≥n para el ejercicio del Plan de Negocios.
Ejecutar y analizar mensualmente el inventario Baja Rotaci√≥n.



Habilidades Personales


Capacidad de comunicaci√≥n y de trabajo en equipo.
Capacidad de organizaci√≥n, priorizaci√≥n y atenci√≥n al detalle.
Capacidad para analizar, anticipar y resolver problemas complejos (t√©cnicos, operativos o relacionados con el negocio).



Requerimientos De Formaci√≥n


T√©cnico Superior en Administraci√≥n y Finanzas.
No se requiere experiencia.
Conocimientos en Inform√°tica a nivel de usuario.
Conocimientos Excel y otras herramientas Office. Muy valorable conocimiento en Power Apps y PowerBI.
Deseables conocimientos en SAP.
Valorable conocimientos previos de Industria Farmac√©utica o afines.
Idiomas: Ingl√©s Fluido hablado y escrito (B2).



Horario


Flexible.
