Title: Data analyst (Tableau)
Description:
About Pepper Group Spain

Pepper Group Spain is investing in the development of a loan servicing platform and broader eco system with the aspiration to provide the modular elements of the platform to internal and third party customers on a SaaS basis.




About the role

As a data analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide insights and recommendations to the business. You will work closely with the data team to develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using Tableau.




Location: Madrid




Main Responsibilities

Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements.
Developing and maintaining data models to support business reporting and analysis.
Creating and maintaining Tableau dashboards and reports to visualize data and provide insights.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Communicating findings and recommendations to business stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity by performing data quality checks and validations.
Staying up to date with the latest Tableau features and best practices.




Your skills

At least 5 years of experience in financial services and data/Tableau experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in SQL and data modelling.
Experience with Tableau Desktop and Server.
Ability to create complex queries and visualizations in Tableau.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics)
Strong English skills.




Our benefits

Private health insurance + dental program for all employees from 3rd month.
Tax benefits in services such as day care, commuting cost, health, and food.
Life insurance from day 1 for all employees.
Flexible hybrid working model.
Healthy snacks at the office.
Wellness program with workshops and webinars.
Team building activities such as Christmas, Summer event, Football team.
Voluntary initiatives (Ning√∫n Ni√±o sin sonrisa, Ning√∫n ni√±o sin mochila, Fundaci√≥n Aladina, Asociaci√≥n Espa√±ola Ayuda contra el Cancer, Fundaci√≥n Prader Willi, Guillermo Prieto Ciclista, Bancos de Alimentos)







Pepper‚Äôs values and culture

Our mission is to help people succeed. Our clients, our customers, our employees. Our Values are ‚ÄòCan do‚Äô, ‚ÄòBalanced‚Äô and ‚ÄòReal‚Äô.

Pepper‚Äôs values support our vision, shape our culture and define how we interact with other employees and the attitudes we adopt towards our customers and clients. The values of Pepper support the organisation‚Äôs mission statement.

Pepper Spain‚Äôs unique outcome focused corporate culture aims to deliver fairness and value for clients and customers, consistently exceeding expectations in all measurable performance areas.




Pepper is an equal opportunities employer.

Role Profiles are subject to change in line with business needs.

For more information on this role please email rrhh@pepperservicing.es

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Logistics at full potential










We are currently looking for a talented and passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.










Reporting to the Ste Manager, you will be conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.













What you will do:










Collect, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics techniques and models, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities










Required Education and Experience










To be successful in this role it is essential that you have the following skills:










Knowledge and experience with R
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and BI tools (Business Objects, Microstrategy, Power BI, etc.), databases (Oracle, DB2, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
Strong technical knowledge of MS Excel.
Technical knowledge of SaaS cloud environments (AWS or Azure).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Language skills: Proficiency English

Reporting to the Ste Manager, you will be conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.





What you will do:




  • Collect, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics techniques and models, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Identify and define new process improvement opportunities




Required Education and Experience




To be successful in this role it is essential that you have the following skills:




  • Knowledge and experience with R
  • Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and BI tools (Business Objects, Microstrategy, Power BI, etc.), databases (Oracle, DB2, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
  • Strong technical knowledge of MS Excel.
  • Technical knowledge of SaaS cloud environments (AWS or Azure).
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
  • Language skills: Proficiency English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We welcome you to an ambitious and growing global company, where we take pride in what we achieve together.

Hempel is a leading coating manufacturer that delivers solutions to clients which affect their operation and the environment. One of our key solutions is marine coatings that save fuel for our clients and reduce Co2 emissions. It is a strategic priority for Hempel to get a deeper understanding on the impact that our solutions have for our customers, and to advise them on the best and most sustainable solutions for their particular vessels. This is where you come in as our new Data Analyst.

With your self-motivated, energetic, and proactive attitude, you will have the opportunity to become part of Hempel‚Äôs Marine Data and Technology team. Our global clients depend on us for data and insights on diverse subjects like hull coating upgrades, regulatory strategies, and sustainability. We also offer advanced digital solutions to assess the efficiency of Hempel coatings.

Make a significant impact by influencing key business decisions, reporting directly to our Manager of Hull Performance and Analytics.

This role offers flexibility to be based in our offices in Athens, Greece; Poliny√†, Spain; or Sharjah, UAE. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive decision-making and engage daily with colleagues from around the globe.

What You Can Look Forward To In This Role


Maintaining and improving BI tools, including dashboards, calculations, and the development of clear visualizations and overviews to support internal data evaluation processes.
Developing new Power BI dashboards based on expert input.
Analyzing and communicating data to sales colleagues and customers, demonstrating the impact of different coating and hull maintenance strategies on fuel consumption and CO2 emissions.
Conducting statistical or machine learning analyses to identify correlations and trends across various databases.
Training sales colleagues in the use of BI tools and dashboards.
Extracting knowledge for predictive models from existing data.


What does it take to become our new team member?


A technical background in mathematics, engineering, or similar fields.
Experience with Power BI or other BI visualization tools.
Basic coding/programming skills and understanding (Python or similar).
A flair for design and graphical representation.
Proficiency in English (corporate language).


Global career possibilities

In Hempel we offer a variety of global career possibilities and many cross functional and cross-cultural working relationships. We strive to build the right conditions for personal and professional development.

Attractive salary and excellent compensation and benefits package are also part of the advantages of this role.

Application and further information

To apply for this position, please submit your application/motivation letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system by clicking the link ‚ÄòApply‚Äô.

More About Hempel

At Hempel, you‚Äôre welcomed into a global community of 7,500 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We‚Äôre on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company ‚Äì and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to ensuring everyone feels safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work. We believe that inclusion is key to innovation, and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.

We are proud to be majority owned by the Hempel Foundation, dedicated to philanthropic activities, with our earnings contributing to many charitable initiatives every year. It means that when you work at Hempel, your hard work and dedication contribute to a greater cause, making your career matter twice.

Learn more about Hempel and our commitments on hempel.com/career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fueling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.

Your background

3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth



Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment



Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more
HTML:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do

  • Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
  • Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
  • Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
  • Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth


Requirements

  • Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
  • Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
  • Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
  • Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment


Benefits

  • Research-oriented team
  • Solve novel problems
  • Stock options
  • Remote working
  • 30-day vacation
  • Allowance for a co-working space
  • Yearly retreat

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:




The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.

We are specifically looking for a Business Analyst III to single-handedly support our Customer Retention Marketing and Blog programs, which have touch points with 5-6 million unique users monthly. This analyst will act as a trusted thought partner to marketing stakeholders with a focus on overhauling data infrastructure, driving measurable outcomes, optimizing our brand content strategy, and scaling cross-sell programs across our many customer engagement channels. They will have experience operating autonomously to deliver on complex, cross-functional initiatives.




Your Responsibilities:

Build the lifecycle data infrastructure from the ground up ‚Äì defining our measurement strategy (A/B tests, rotating holdouts, etc.), building conversion-based datasets for near-real-time customer interactions, and facilitating an expansion into push notifications and paid reactivation campaigns
Partner with our global brand team to optimize our brand content across multiple channels, including email, blog, and organic channels.
Own the cross-sell analytical functions for our email and blog programs, growing the reach of our brand voice to new target audiences.
Influence the global strategy of your partner teams by crafting and refining key performance indicators that measure the health of our business




Your Qualifications:

At least 4 years experience working cross-functionally with complex datasets to support organizational decision making.
Fluency in SQL. You would feel confident reviewing code produced by other analysts and data scientists, as well as assisting non-technical colleagues with their reports in an office hours setting.
Hands-on experience running A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
Familiarity with programming in Python or R.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate models and results to business partners in a useful, concise, and meaningful way.
Experience working with cross-functional business partners to define business problems, scope project deliverables/timelines, implement reporting solutions, and frame organizational strategy.
You prioritize your work on impact to the business and can gracefully push back on stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Two-sided marketplace and/or marketing analytics experience
Understanding of digital touchpoints and measurement mechanisms
Marketing analytics with a focus on customer lifecycle marketing
Meaningful experience processing large data sets at scale. This could include languages like Python or R, as well as frameworks like Spark, Hive, or dbt.
Experience with AWS (Redshift, S3, EMR)
Understanding of modeling techniques, such as linear regressions, causal impact models, and bootstrapping. You know the trade-offs of each of these models and can propose the right model for the test at hand




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you‚Äôll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we‚Äôre pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Logistics at full potential










We are currently looking for a talented and passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.










Reporting to the Ste Manager, you will be conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.













What you will do:










Collect, interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics techniques and models, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases / data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities










Required Education and Experience










To be successful in this role it is essential that you have the following skills:










Knowledge and experience with R
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and BI tools (Business Objects, Microstrategy, Power BI, etc.), databases (Oracle, DB2, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
Strong technical knowledge of MS Excel.
Technical knowledge of SaaS cloud environments (AWS or Azure).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Language skills: Proficiency English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We welcome you to an ambitious and growing global company, where we take pride in what we achieve together.

Hempel is a leading coating manufacturer that delivers solutions to clients which affect their operation and the environment. One of our key solutions is marine coatings that save fuel for our clients and reduce Co2 emissions. It is a strategic priority for Hempel to get a deeper understanding on the impact that our solutions have for our customers, and to advise them on the best and most sustainable solutions for their particular vessels. This is where you come in as our new Data Analyst.

With your self-motivated, energetic, and proactive attitude, you will have the opportunity to become part of Hempel‚Äôs Marine Data and Technology team. Our global clients depend on us for data and insights on diverse subjects like hull coating upgrades, regulatory strategies, and sustainability. We also offer advanced digital solutions to assess the efficiency of Hempel coatings.

Make a significant impact by influencing key business decisions, reporting directly to our Manager of Hull Performance and Analytics.

This role offers flexibility to be based in our offices in Athens, Greece; Poliny√†, Spain; or Sharjah, UAE. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive decision-making and engage daily with colleagues from around the globe.

What You Can Look Forward To In This Role


Maintaining and improving BI tools, including dashboards, calculations, and the development of clear visualizations and overviews to support internal data evaluation processes.
Developing new Power BI dashboards based on expert input.
Analyzing and communicating data to sales colleagues and customers, demonstrating the impact of different coating and hull maintenance strategies on fuel consumption and CO2 emissions.
Conducting statistical or machine learning analyses to identify correlations and trends across various databases.
Training sales colleagues in the use of BI tools and dashboards.
Extracting knowledge for predictive models from existing data.


What does it take to become our new team member?


A technical background in mathematics, engineering, or similar fields.
Experience with Power BI or other BI visualization tools.
Basic coding/programming skills and understanding (Python or similar).
A flair for design and graphical representation.
Proficiency in English (corporate language).


Global career possibilities

In Hempel we offer a variety of global career possibilities and many cross functional and cross-cultural working relationships. We strive to build the right conditions for personal and professional development.

Attractive salary and excellent compensation and benefits package are also part of the advantages of this role.

Application and further information

To apply for this position, please submit your application/motivation letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system by clicking the link ‚ÄòApply‚Äô.

More About Hempel

At Hempel, you‚Äôre welcomed into a global community of 7,500 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We‚Äôre on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company ‚Äì and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to ensuring everyone feels safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work. We believe that inclusion is key to innovation, and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.

We are proud to be majority owned by the Hempel Foundation, dedicated to philanthropic activities, with our earnings contributing to many charitable initiatives every year. It means that when you work at Hempel, your hard work and dedication contribute to a greater cause, making your career matter twice.

Learn more about Hempel and our commitments on hempel.com/career.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Senior Data Analyst




Who Are We?




At Interactvty, we empower businesses to create next-generation OTT 2.0 platforms that offer dynamic, interactive experiences for both first and second screens. Our cutting-edge technology delivers seamless compatibility across all Smart TV operating systems, mobile devices, and web platforms.




From delivering live, interactive content to ensuring global reach on-demand, we‚Äôre redefining how audiences connect with media. And now, we‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to help us innovate further.

üîπ Innovate at Scale: Work on groundbreaking technology that‚Äôs revolutionizing OTT 2.0 platforms, making media experiences more immersive and engaging.

Create data models and establish relationships between datasets

Experience in statistical analysis and predictive modeling

Excellent data storytelling abilities

Python, R, SQL
Power BI
Excel (Advanced)
Statistical Analysis Tools
Data Visualization Platforms




Additional Skills:




Big Data technologies
Machine Learning
Business Intelligence tools
Data modeling and ETL processes

üåé Global Impact: Contribute to a platform used by businesses worldwide to create unforgettable experiences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek üöÄ, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe üåé supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




üáµüáπ Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center ‚Äì Sodexo Business Services ‚Äì SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several üìäüßæFinancial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







üí• Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




üíº We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




‚öô What will you do?

Collaborating with teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear, actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.




ü§ô What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor's/Master's degree in data/computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
2/3 years relevant experience
Strong Power BI experience (data visualization/reporting)
Strong data manipulation, transformation, query languages knowledge (SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, DBT, Databricks)
Good understanding of statistical methods (statistical software exp. is a plus)
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to translate business needs into data models/analytics solutions.
Analytical with attention to detail and accuracy.
Problem-solving & methodical
Autonomous & multitasker
Proactive with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies




üéâ What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee‚Äôs birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team¬¥s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that¬¥s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
At adidas Porto, our diverse team of over 900 employees, representing 40 nationalities, creates a powerful mix of global talent. Located in Maia, Porto, this location covers key areas such as Finance, Procurement, Accounts & Sales Ops, HR & Payroll, Supply Chain, Digital, Tech, and Data, among others.

We are running internships in 3 different Data areas: Data Science, Machine Learning, and Product Ownership.


As a Data Science intern, you'll support a proof of concept for Advanced Analytics within adidas' global supply chain. Your focus may include exploring machine learning applications for areas like global sourcing and customs, as well as potential uses of Generative AI.
As a Machine Learning intern, you‚Äôll help bridge the gap between advanced AI research and practical, scalable solutions, empowering businesses across various domains. Join a project focused on designing user-friendly tools and frameworks to bring Generative AI into real-world industry applications.
As a Data Product Owner intern, you'll support the Demand Planning team by gathering and translating business requirements into Jira stories for the data engineering team. You'll work closely with stakeholders to ensure the requirements are clear, actionable, and aligned with project goals. Your role will also involve prioritizing tasks and ensuring smooth team communication to drive efficient product development.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Master's students in statistics, physics, mathematics, IT, system engineering, or related.
Enrolled in a Portuguese university and eligible for a curricular internship.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?


A paid internship up to 9 months with other adidas benefits.
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours.
A sports-driven, international and diverse work environment.
State-of-art office space and conditions.


HOW WILL THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS BE?


Step 1. Apply with your English Resume.
Step 2. You'll receive a WePow for a pre-recorded video interview.
Step 3. You'll be invited for an on-site interview in our office.


The start date for this internship will be March 10th 2025.

adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Power BI Experience;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluent English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
